casebody.data:
LOUIS C. HECKNER vs. MARGARET M. HECKNER. Divorce: both parties guilty. Where each of the parties to a hill and cross-bill for divorce appears guilty of offenses that would he sufficient grounds for granting a divorce, the relief should he granted to neither. Decided April 7th, 1915. Appeal from the Circuit Court of Baltimore City. (Dawkins, J.)

The cause was argued before Boyd, C. L, Briscoe, Burke, Thomas, Pattison, Urner, Stockbridge and Constable, JJ.

Geo. Moore Brady (with whom was Wm. Milnes Maloy and John W. Reynolds, Jr., on the brief), for the appellant. Henry M. Siegel (with whom was Wm. H. Lawrence on the brief), for the appellee. Boyd, C. J.,

delivered the opinion of the Court.
